verses.text: 耶和華對摩西說：

words.note: Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 「你要告訴亞倫：『你點燈的時候，七盞燈都要照向燈臺的前面。』」

words.note: Verb-object compound specific to lighting lamps/lights.
Forms an adverbial phrase 'when you light the lamps'.

verses.text: 亞倫就這樣行了；他把燈臺上的燈都點著了，使光照向燈臺的前面，正如耶和華吩咐摩西的。

words.note: Indicates a consequence or immediate action.
Used to bring the object before the verb, emphasizing the result.
Used as a locative suffix here, 'on the lampstand'.
'著' (zháo) indicates successful completion of the action '點'.
Common in biblical context for divine commands.
Forms a descriptive clause modifying the previous action.

verses.text: 這燈臺的做法是這樣：是用金子錘出來的，從座到花都是錘出來的。摩西製造燈臺，是照著耶和華指示的樣式做的。

words.note: Describes a specific method of crafting, often seen in biblical texts.
Refers to the decorative elements on the lampstand.
Repeated for emphasis on the crafting method.
Used in the '是...的' construction to emphasize information.
Completes the '是...的' construction.

verses.text: 耶和華對摩西說：
verses.heading: The Separation of the Levites

verses.text: 「你要從以色列人中間選出利未人，潔淨他們。

words.note: Common in biblical context for ritual purity.

verses.text: 你潔淨他們當這樣行：要把除罪水灑在他們身上，又叫他們用剃刀剃全身；把衣服洗淨，潔淨自己。

words.note: Refers to water used for ceremonial cleansing from sin or defilement.

verses.text: 然後，叫他們取一頭公牛犢和同獻的素祭，就是用油調和的細麵；你要另取一頭公牛犢，作贖罪祭。

words.note: Specifically refers to a young male calf, common for sacrifices.
An offering of flour, often with oil and frankincense, not involving blood.
Refers to finely ground flour, typically used for offerings.
An offering made to atone for sin, usually involving shedding of blood.

verses.text: 你要把利未人帶到會幕前面，又要召集以色列的全體會眾；

words.note: Lit. 'tent of meeting,' the portable sanctuary of the Israelites.

verses.text: 你要把利未人帶到耶和華面前，以色列人要按手在他們身上。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God, often rendered 'LORD' in English Bibles.
A ritual act signifying blessing, consecration, or transfer of authority/sin.

verses.text: 亞倫要把利未人獻在耶和華面前，作以色列人中的搖祭，使他們辦理耶和華的事務。
利未人要按手在那兩頭牛的頭上；你要把一隻作贖罪祭，一隻作燔祭，獻給耶和華，為利未人贖罪。

words.note: A ritual act of blessing or consecration.
Lit. 'redeem sin sacrifice'.
Lit. 'burnt sacrifice'.
Lit. 'redeem sin'.

verses.text: 你又要叫利未人站在亞倫和他的兒子們面前，把他們作搖祭獻給耶和華。
「這樣，你要把利未人從以色列人中分別出來，利未人就要歸我。
以後，利未人可以進去辦理會幕的事；你要潔淨他們，把他們作搖祭獻上。

words.note: Lit. 'meeting tent'.
Often used in religious contexts for ritual purity.

verses.text: 因為他們是以色列人中完全獻給我的；我選出了他們歸我，是代替以色列人中所有頭生的。
因為以色列人中所有頭生的，連人帶畜都是我的；我在埃及地擊殺所有頭生的那一天，就把他們分別為聖歸我了。

words.note: Refers specifically to domesticated animals, common in biblical texts.
Refers to dedicating something or someone to God.

verses.text: 我選出了利未人，代替以色列人中所有頭生的。
我從以色列人中，把利未人賜給亞倫和他的眾子，在會幕裡辦理以色列人的事務，又為以色列人贖罪，免得他們走近聖所的時候，就有災禍臨到他們。」

words.note: Refers to the portable sanctuary used by Israelites.
Lit. 'redeem sin', a key concept in biblical theology.

verses.text: 摩西、亞倫和以色列的全體會眾，就向利未人這樣行了；耶和華指著利未人吩咐摩西的，以色列人都照樣向他們行了。
於是利未人潔淨了自己，把衣服洗淨；亞倫把他們作搖祭獻在耶和華面前；亞倫又為他們贖罪，潔淨他們。

words.note: Often used in religious or ceremonial contexts.
A specific type of ritual offering in ancient Israel.
The Hebrew name of God, often rendered as 'LORD' in English Bibles.
A core concept in Biblical theology.
Often used in religious or ceremonial contexts.

verses.text: 然後，利未人才進去，在亞倫和他的眾子面前，在會幕裡辦理他們的事務；耶和華指著利未人怎樣吩咐摩西，以色列人就怎樣向他們行了。

words.note: Used to denote 'all his sons' or 'his sons' collectively.
The portable sanctuary used by the Israelites.
The Hebrew name of God, often rendered as 'LORD' in English Bibles.

verses.text: 耶和華對摩西說：

words.note: The Hebrew name of God, often rendered as 'LORD' in English Bibles.

verses.heading: The Work of the Levites

verses.text: 「關於利未人的職責是這樣：從二十五歲以上的，要進來辦理會幕裡的事務；

words.note: The portable sanctuary used by the Israelites.

verses.text: 到了五十歲，就要停止辦理事務，不再辦事；
只要在會幕裡幫助自己的兄弟，盡忠職守，事務卻不必辦理了。關於利未人的職守，你要這樣向他們行。」

words.definition: as long as, only need to

words.note: Lit. 'gathering tent'
A four-character idiom (成語) meaning to be devoted to one's duties.
Can refer to the specific responsibilities of a position.
